website_summaries.verdict: A durable workhorse available at a bargain price.
pros: This post hole digger has an oversized cushion grip that helps provide a little more comfort in hard working conditions
There is a handy ruler on the handle to let you know how deep you've gone
cons: The hardwood handles are sturdy, but wood can be flawed
Rarely, but it does happen, you can get a clunker that splits after only a few holes

customer_reviews.title: Death by Post Hole Digger
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality with sharp edges. The only drawback is that my wife now thinks digging in the hard desert is a breeze. She buys a plant a week. Think I've shredded a rotator cuff. She has me digging this long 3' x 6' area, down 30 inches. She says it's for a hedge, but it looks like it would be just right for my body. If you see a novel with the title, Death by Post Hole Digger, you'll know the truth. Don't buy one of these. It makes it too easy to dig holes - even in the hard desert.
customer_reviews.author: ArizonaJoe

customer_reviews.title: Lifespan 1 hole!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely garbage. This item lasted exactly one and one half holes digging in soft dirt. If you have more than one hole to dig, or are looking for a tool that you can use for several years, look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Stuffing Boy

customer_reviews.title: Broke on 2nd hole -- disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We got this product promptly, and the price was competitive. I was happy to have Amazon deliver it so I didn't have to fit one into my car. Unfortunately, it's just not very strong. Broke on the 2nd hole, and we were not doing anything extreme -- just 24 inch deep holes in pretty soft soil. Really bummed because I was hoping that we'd mirror the positive reviews for this product.
customer_reviews.author: RST

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for , very sturdy piece of equipment , I needed to plant some trees in my yard , ( very rocky soil ) , so I purchased this , " Post Hole " digger to dig said holes , to plant said trees and it worked , the depth measurement printed on the side of one of the handles , is very handy especially since I needed to plant the trees at a depth of 2 feet , per the planting instructions that came with these trees , Thank You Very Much , I am one very satisfied customer !!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchel W. Racanelli

customer_reviews.title: broke after a couple days of use - see picture
customer_reviews.text: broke after a couple days of use. Either badly designed or very low quality construction. Metal part is constructed of two parts that are bolted together. All three bolts snapped during a routing soft ground digging.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy K.

customer_reviews.title: It dug a hole.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to dig one (1) hole and didn't have one of these. It was the best-priced one I could find (including local hardware and big-box stores) and it did the job. I wouldn't think of using this for a daily driver tool, but it's priced at a nearly "disposable tool" level and at that level, it's certainly a five-star item. Long term, I'd go with heavy-duty fiberglass handles, though.
customer_reviews.author: MLT

customer_reviews.title: Not 68 inches as described
customer_reviews.text: It's a standard 48" not 68" as advertised -- the shipping box is 68"
customer_reviews.author: WStevenson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, helpful, and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This post hole digger has nice grips on the ends that don’t slip. It’s has measurements in the side to tell you how far down you dug. I bought this for my husband and father who are building our fence around our property and they couldn’t thank me enough for getting such a nice useful post hole digger. This said only if it dug the holes itself would it be any better. :)
customer_reviews.author: Chris Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Built like a Brick <<<<< House
customer_reviews.text: Do not pass this item up -- unless you will never need this tool. For the price and the construction you can not pass it up!
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Batiato

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really work well. Doesn't really grab the dirt ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't really work well. Doesn't really grab the dirt. I ended up just using a regular shovel instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Good post hole digger.
customer_reviews.text: It's a post hole digger what more can I say? It was a couple of dollars less than the local stores and delivered to my house. Can't beat that.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Had a month, I've done two projects in rocky dirt and seems to be doing good.
customer_reviews.author: Luke F Evans

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Works great and just as sturdy as any at the hardware store but I got it for less. Also the inches being marked right on the handle was a nice added feature.
customer_reviews.author: THE MAN

customer_reviews.title: Wood handles are not sturdy. Upgrade for the fiberglass handles.
customer_reviews.text: One of the handles snapped on the second of 2 holes. Very poor quality. I expected more. I was only digging 30” deep holes for a clothesline.
customer_reviews.author: Linkous

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: All AMES products I have purchased are great tools at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Master

customer_reviews.title: I dig it.
customer_reviews.text: It does get wobbly after some use, but it worked well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Purdin

customer_reviews.title: worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I have dug 37 holes 15" deep with these in Alabama clay. I gotta say they work well despite other reviews otherwise. For me it is a great purchase and love the measuring device on side
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great tool! Bought it for my farm but borrowed ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! Bought it for my farm but borrowed it to a friend to redo his fence;calls it a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Macaully

customer_reviews.title: Digs Holes Well
customer_reviews.text: The wooden handle is very strong and sturdy. It is a very manual tool, but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Obie

customer_reviews.title: Great tool and well made
customer_reviews.text: Great for hand digging post holes. Love the handle grips and measuring units on the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Estelle Scheaffer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool but not as described.
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 5 stars if it was 68" as described, only 58" on arrival.
customer_reviews.author: robert W

customer_reviews.title: Used for my mailbox post
customer_reviews.text: Digs a nice hole but probably could have used a shovel but when I replace our fence eventually I am sure this will help out
customer_reviews.author: Nutritionist Michael

customer_reviews.title: Arrived the next day!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived amazingly fast. It looks very sturdy. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Summer CW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for my small job dug out to 28 inches deep
customer_reviews.author: Carl & Linda

customer_reviews.title: Very good product..
customer_reviews.text: Well made, good workmanship,nice hardwood handles,easy to handle for my jobs around our home.
customer_reviews.author: Peewee Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap - get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Handle snapped off and husband had to fix it before we could use it by replacing the wooden handle. Bad wood. Glad my husband is handy!
customer_reviews.author: V Bonner

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the shed!
customer_reviews.text: Great post hole digger! A must have if you live in the country!
customer_reviews.author: G. Hess

customer_reviews.title: Good for consumer
customer_reviews.text: This works well for digging posts. However, it is not for pros, definitely works for consumer's use.
customer_reviews.author: justpassinby

customer_reviews.title: Makes a difficult job, much easier!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and living to its good reviews and reputation! Makes a difficult job, much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Elias

customer_reviews.title: Packaging needs work
customer_reviews.text: The post hole digger is great! Ames needs to bubble wrap the handles before shipping though. The first tool I received the rubber grip was ripped. The replacement tool received the handle grips were not ripped but marked up pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: garden time
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and just what I wanted to plant some trees
customer_reviews.author: eugenia robbins

customer_reviews.title: I could easily snap the handle in half if I wasn’t careful ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay for 10 fence posts then it started to bend. I could easily snap the handle in half if I wasn’t careful with it. They just don’t make things like they used to..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have dug several holes with this. No problems,very sturdy,easy to use. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Works better than expected, probably because of such a wet Spring!
customer_reviews.author: Tempus Fugit

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Do not get this if you have hard soils. Not For the western half of the country!
customer_reviews.author: Billy Gardens

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the second time we used it.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for the first hole we dug, but broke the second time we tried to use it. The 3 rivets on the blade snapped clean off. This is junk and I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Julia P.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but needs a bit of refining
customer_reviews.text: Well built except for too much play at the shovel end.
customer_reviews.author: M. Huck

customer_reviews.title: FLIMSY!
customer_reviews.text: VERY THIN METAL...BENT OUT OF SHAPE A FEW TIMES. BEARLY MADE IT THROUGH THE ONE HOLE I HAD TO DIG.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Ruler is a nice addition. Ames is a good digging tool for the money.
customer_reviews.author: MCC

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: better than the ones in my local home improvement store at a better price
customer_reviews.author: lisa pynn-smith

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty enough for my limited home owner use and worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight E.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used it a few times. It works. Not too heavy but enough it can make a hole.
customer_reviews.author: Ilander525

customer_reviews.title: It worked ike it should
customer_reviews.text: I needed it to clean out a catch basin and it did the jaob.
customer_reviews.author: Jaspard A.

customer_reviews.title: Never again.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Handle snapped off on the very first try of using it. Didn't even have it in the dirt 2 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Watcher

product_meta.title: AMES 2701600 Post Hole Digger with Hardwood Measurement Handle, 68-Inch
product_meta.description: The Ames post hole digger is used for digging post holes for decks and fencing. It can also be used to dig footings. This tool is ideal for digging precise holes for projects like fence posts and in ground supports.
feature_bullets: Measuring stick on the handle for accuracy in hole depths
Hardwood handle for strength and durability
Used to dig fence post holes and in ground support for decks and mail boxes

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars244 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
